name: WASP-190
scenarioDescription:
The WASP-190 Exoplanetary System


Overview

WASP-190 is a star with 1.35 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.6 times its radius. It is located 1796.3367855999998 light years away from the solar system.

WASP-190 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the WASP-190 system

WASP-190 b

WASP-190 b was discovered by the WASP-South observatory using the Transit method. The mass of WASP-190 b is 317.83 times the mass of Earth. The radius of WASP-190 b is 12.89 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, WASP-190 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system. At more than 50 Earth masses, WASP-190 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system WASP-190, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by WASP-South.
